Hi! Welcome to my collection of fun visualizations

  • This shows an embedding on a dog dataset in 2D.

  • Given an embedding, we here visualize the decision boundaries for a knn-regression model for phenotype prediction. This give an insight on how using more neighbours smoothes the decision boundary. From the results on the poster we see that the best prediction score is obtained at k=12, a middle-ground between too much smoothing, and too little (which yields overfitting).

This is a collection of dimensionality reduction results on genetic data, specifically using contrastive learning.
